column4: ok, I'm installing/configing mpd using this howto: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=31763  but when I try the $ sudo dpkg-reconfigure mpd nothing happens
I just installed from source?
I think thats just for editting config right? gksudo gedit /etc/mpd.conf
no, I installed using apt
I have no idea what I need to change to make it work
Do you want me to give you my conf file?
Yeah. Basically just set up your music directory at the top and enable alsa
oh ok
the howto explains making symlinks in the music-folder
Yeah I tried that. I found it unnecessary though
Mine just points to "/media/Music" (my music directory)
Then symlinking would be the best way of going about it.
Create ~/music, then symlink all your other music directories into there, and point MPD to ~/music
Not ssh. MPD is just a server. You can run mpd on your ubuntu box and connect to it via a media player on windows
can't I use mpc over ssh? I'm not sure, I thought it worked that way too
no I want to access/listen my music over ssh
I can x-forward though ;) but that doesn't forward sound
Why?
Just share your music files with samba.
hmm, no I don't want that
Changed any bios settings lately?
nope
not that i know of
Google it? ubuntuforums.org search?
